content: A train travels at an average speed of 60 miles per hour. How long will it take to travel 300 miles? Show your calculations.

To find out how long it will take for the train to travel 300 miles at an average speed of 60 miles per hour, we can use the formula for time, which is:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{\text{distance}}{\text{speed}} \]

Given that the distance is 300 miles and the speed is 60 miles per hour, we can plug these values into the formula:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{300 \text{ miles}}{60 \text{ miles per hour}} \]

Now, performing the division:

\[ \text{time} = 5 \text{ hours} \]

So, it will take the train 5 hours to travel 300 miles at an average speed of 60 miles per hour.
